report.label: bug
report.description: See Hatboro-Horsham - location and dates overlay on top of each other. We need to put a max-width for the location.

report.label: bug
report.description: For views that have their content set dynamically, we should take out the default text. When loading (it's most obvious on the Event Details), you catch a glimpse of that text (e.g. "Event Name") before its replaced with the real content.

report.summary: Changing orientation switches screen back to "Week 1"
report.label: bug
report.description: Happens everywhere aside from the Settings and when viewing individual event info. Viewing 2012/2013 events and then rotating the screen gives a blank events page on different tabs. Logcat gives the following when the blank page appears: http://pastebin.com/ngw76qAf Going back to 2014 events and switching orientation seems to fix this and brings back the events. Suspect it has something to do with the instance states if I recall correctly from CS class, though I haven't seen android code since the end of last year.

report.summary: Events from different years are not displayed/loaded properly
report.label: bug
report.description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE Launch app, go to Events view Change year from 2014 to 2012 or 2013 At this point, you'll see that the events list is still showing what it did in 2014. This is the first issue. Rotate the device to force a recreation of all activities and fragments At this point the list will be blank, and the LogCat output will reveal a NPE. This is obviously at least an issue with communication between the action bar spinner and the child fragments, but there is also a probably issue with the loading and storing of event data.

report.summary: Teams list occasionally fails to load.
report.label: bug
report.description: Continuing discussion from #24 (comment)

report.summary: Week 1 occasionally loads the Offseason events.
report.label: bug
report.description: It usually only happens when running the app from Android Studio after making/adding a change. Exiting and re-launching the app seems to fix it.

report.summary: Weeks overlap briefly when changing years in fix_event_years
report.label: bug
report.description: Something I noticed after downloading the latest commits (post merge of my PR) It's only for a very brief moment after switching years. It happened too quickly to use the screenshot function, so I ended up recording a short clip, pausing it on the playback and taking a picture.

report.summary: Events by Week Performance Issues in v0.2.2
report.label: bug
report.description: As mentioned in #82: 1995 isn't displaying events for some reason. Throwing a NPE, too. Pastie: http://pastie.org/private/gro8lli8uu5vw5mxwdeafw 2007 preseason events sometimes takes over the offseason events when stress testing. I have also produced a rare case where 2014 offseason events showed up in 2004 offseason. Didn't take a picture as I wasn't thinking and caused an NPE by clicking an event :\ Haven't reproduced it since, so it's probably one of those that you really have to push the fragment to its limit in order to get. Noticeable lag/stutter in the navbar when switching from the Teams activity to the Events activity if the Teams activity is downloading information for the first time. I have gotten it to freeze by changing the team range tabs rapidly and then switching to Events, but like the above one, haven't gotten it since for likely the same reasons.

report.summary: Array OOB exception when trying to view data offline.
report.label: bug
report.description: This happened when trying to view event info and Team @ Event, so I'm guessing it has something to do with the APIResponse.mergeCodes method. Also tested on master branch, so nothing to do with the no data indicators. YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3bdRs7xCjrc Pastie: http://pastie.org/private/bzse6etvyw38tajoshpq

report.summary: Team page link in event teams list does not always work properly
report.label: bug
report.description: This bug is kind of hard to reproduce, but it definitely happens sometimes. The bug is this: from the teams @ event page, when you click the (i) to go to a team's page, it doesn't always respond immediately. Sometimes it takes a few seconds to open the activity; other times it never opens. However, scrolling the list will cause all previous click events to fire rapidly in the order they were received, opening all of the desired activities at once. Note that if you first scroll the list and then click on the (i), it functions as expected. I can't make heads or tails of this. It's almost like the ListView is temporarily consuming the click events and then firing them once the list scrolls.

report.label: bug
report.description: Both bugs happen in both team events and media. Rotating the screen makes the action bar disappear. Switching years then rotating the screen causes an IllegalStateException in the events fragment and an Array OOB exception in the media fragment. Sometimes it doesn't trigger if there is no media/events for a particular year, sometimes it does. YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3EbR_5TKXT4 Pastie (ISE): http://pastie.org/private/dhbsldvho6nbyo50x09nyq Pastie (OOB): http://pastie.org/private/muaotihtwcvg2h9pmdidgw

report.label: bug
report.description: It sometimes takes multiple tries to scroll by dragging the slider. http://youtu.be/n6Nr2HHyZM0 verticalvideo #notmyfault

report.summary: IllegalStateException when trying to view any past events.
report.label: bug
report.description: Tested on latest master. Fails on pretty much any event that's not from 2014. YouTube: http://youtu.be/jGysAtckHkg Pastie: http://pastie.org/private/t79vx0ouqlrcpyuvnhonw

report.summary: Tense on team at event view wrong.
report.label: bug
report.description: 1280 and 1323 at SVR says "... are currently playing in the semifinals" because they only played 1 match (got subbed out for the others).

report.label: bug
report.description: logcat screams this a lot when loading the giant list of teams. Spamming tabs also causes more screaming and noticeable stuttering/lag. StackOverflow gives a lot of varying/irrelevant answers, but I'm guessing it has something to do with the creation of the cursor. 06-17 21:09:10.567 32731-32731/com.thebluealliance.androidclient.development W/View﹕ requestLayout() improperly called by android.widget.TextView{426dbcb8 V.ED.... ......ID 0,0-214,38 #7f0a0054 app:id/team_name} during layout: running second layout pass 06-17 21:09:10.567 32731-32731/com.thebluealliance.androidclient.development W/View﹕ requestLayout() improperly called by android.widget.TextView{426dc108 V.ED.... ......ID 0,38-210,76 #7f0a0058 app:id/team_location} during layout: running second layout pass

report.summary: Rotating device during initial data load breaks loading message
report.label: bug
report.description: Ends up saying "Loading teams %d to %d" until all the data has loaded, and never gets to the final screen.

report.summary: Team @ Event matches out of order
report.label: bug
report.description: Such as 254 @ 2014 Silicon Valley. API doesn't guarantee order.

report.summary: Scrolling through a long match results list isn't smooth
report.label: bug
report.description: At least not on my Moto X.

report.summary: Expanded dropdowns close after data load
report.label: bug
report.description: This applies to both Team @ Event and Event activities. If there is cached data and the user expands one of the dropdowns (such as for Qualification Matches), after the API call in the background completes and updates with refreshed data, the dropdown gets reset and is closed. Not sure how easy this is to fix, but it's a very annoying experience for someone who is using the app quickly.

report.summary: App crashes on events where teams have multiple robots
report.label: bug
report.description: Some offseason events such as 2012mttd allow two robots, so there is team 971 and 971B

report.summary: Can't switch to any event year after the first switch
report.label: bug
report.description: I can switch to one year fine after opening the app. Trying to switch years after that does nothing. Opening and closing the nav drawer (only after the action bar title switches to "The Blue Alliance") is the only workaround I've found at the moment. EDIT: I noticed the search and refresh disappear after changing... YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J-Icvb5ToEM

report.summary: Some dates in Event by Week get formatted wrong on refresh
report.label: bug
report.description: I first discovered in this in the view-holder-implementation branch and thought it was caused by something in the new changes, then I switched back to master, and was greeted with a /nope. This happens in pretty much all weeks/years, but I noticed it happening more frequently in the 2012 offseason events. Just go to a week and keep refreshing until you notice text being changed. Some of the formatting wackyness I've observed so far include event date days having two zeros added to the front (e.g. 27 becomes 0027, 8 becomes 0008) and month/dates being randomly changed, sometimes making the date out of order and breaking the laws of time-space continuum (as you can see in the screenshots, the 2012 CalGames date gets some funky dates)

report.label: bug
report.description: The background of the message indicating the user is not connected is partially transparent. This isn't an issue on a white background: But, when a user navigates to an activity where there is text behind the message, the text behind shows through. There may be other errors surrounding this message as well.

report.summary: Loss of connection during initial download
report.label: bug
report.description: If the user loses connection during the initial download of information, the text jumps to "loading 1992 events" and even if the user gains connection again the text does not update and the download does not complete.

report.summary: Second Populate task re-downloading extra/erroneous data
report.label: bug
report.description: What seems to happen is that the results load fine with data initially, but then the second load gives back empty adapter groups for some reason, causing the "no data" message to appear when it shouldn't. EDIT: A similar problem in PopulateMatchInfo is also causing match info to display a YouTube video thumbnail twice.

report.summary: IllegalStateException when scrolling after leaving match activity
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: View a match from the results tab in an event. Exit back into the results tab, but immediately afterwards, start scrolling. Pastie: http://pastie.org/private/b3cbqolnn8xahaymbbgxtq

report.summary: "Not picked for an alliance" isn't always correct
report.label: bug
report.description: Example: frc604 @ 2010arc Team@Event currently shows "Not picked for an alliance" for events where we don't have alliance selection data. We won't be able to show pick order, but the alliance number can be determined from the QF match set.

report.summary: IllegalStateException when scrolling after leaving match activity. Again.
report.label: bug
report.description: Similar to #184, but happens when leaving a match in team@event

report.summary: Prevent the same EventTeam from being added multiple times
report.label: bug
report.description: Not sure how to reproduce, but if you use the app for a while, and look at a team's events, it often ends up having multiple of the same event. We should prevent EventTeams with the same id (such as 2014casj_frc254) from being added multiple times.

report.label: bug
report.description: For example, says "Semis 2 match 1" instead of "Semis 1 match 2."

report.label: bug
report.description: I installed the current release (2.0.1) on a Galaxy Nexus running Android 4.3 and a Nexus S running Android 4.1.2. They aren't showing the Notifications slide-up at the bottom of screens like an event's Matches tab. They repeatedly pop up a dialog asking to enable MyTBA even though I enabled MyTBA in the startup sequence (and it did successfully fetch my favorites) and in previous pop-up dialogs. I don't see anything interesting in logcat. Ah! Enabling MyTBA from Settings worked on both phones.

report.summary: Figure out what to do with the FAB
report.label: bug
report.description: On the "info" pages of most models, there is a FAB that opens the fav/sub interface. However, when the content is tall enough, the FAB can cover portions of it. We have a few options in this case: a) add some padding or a blank view to the bottom of every list b) hide the FAB when you scroll down I like option A, because we could probably make an adapter to do that for us. B also wouldn't work if the content is just slightly shorter than the height of the screen, because then the view wouldn't be scrollable and you couldn't hide the FAB. Any thoughts on this?

report.summary: "Favorite" does not reset when resetting preferences to initial state
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce Open an event Open the Fav/Sub settings panel Mark the event as "Favorite" Click the "X" to cancel Expected result The "Favorite" checkbox should be restored to its initial unchecked state. Actual result It isn't.

report.summary: Profile picture doesn't load on first activity creation
report.label: bug
report.description: If you start the app from a cold state (not backgrounded, no tasks running),the profile picture in the nav drawer doesn't load. It will load on any subsequent activity creations (child activities, home activity recreated after orientation change), but it refuses to load on the first activity creation, even after being cached. The cover photo, however, does load.

report.label: bug
report.description: I was testing the app on my friend's S5 when I found this bug. I was on the events list on the home activity when I rotated the device. The events list turned into a progress indicator, like it should.... and the event list never reloaded. When I went into a team view, the event list wouldn't load there (not sure if this is related, but on the team page, the sub/fav settings list didn't load either). My guess is something is holding a lock to the events table and isn't letting go. The weird thing is that this isn't reproducible on my N5 running 5.0. No idea where to start with this one.

When I taped their number, their event activity loaded. I then used the View Team option to see their name and other info. When I backed my way out to the Awards page, the name was displayed. I thought it was odd so I went to the Teams lists and swiped all the way over to the 5000-5999 section. As I scrolled down I got to the point where the names ended and only numbers were listed: I then picked the first team with no name and it loaded just fine. When I went back to the team lists that team now has a name: I tried selecting the Refresh option 5 times and it does not load the data for those higher number teams. The data only loads if I manually select each team. I tried to reproduce this on my Galaxy Tab 2 12 and it lists all of the teams. I checked my wifes G3 and the teams display fine. Should the Refresh option refresh the team info or do I need to try clearing the cache and maybe the existing data? Similarly, my Tab 2 lists team 5538 as "Jaguar Robots" but my G3 and the TBA web site list them as "DVHS Cyborgs". When I open the team on my Tab 2 it will say "DVHS Cyborgs" but when I go back to the view (and Refresh it on the Tab 2), the list view still says "Jaguar Robots".

report.summary: Notifications Not Being Marked As Read
report.label: bug
report.description: Test case: Receive a push notification. (test_notification.py in #379 makes this easy.) Tap the resulting system notification to open a TBA activity. (To reproduce this bug, do not swipe away the notification or clear all notifications.) Receive another push notification. Result: A group summary notification that lists the new notification and the previously dismissed notification. Tap the summary notification. Result: That goes to the Recent Notifications activity, which currently clears the list of "active" notifications. So the next incoming notification will properly display all by itself. This seems to be caused by Android Issue 41253: The deleteIntent of the Notification doesn't get called when the user touches the Notification. The app creates notifications with setAutoCancel(true), which is supposed to make tapping the notification send its delete Intent (dismiss notifications) as well as its content Intent (open an Activity). But Android doesn't send the delete Intent in this case. Since the fix for #382 exacerbates this bug, I'll fix this in the same PR.

report.summary: Remove Events From DB After They're Removed From API
report.label: bug
report.description: TBA Android shows "Carter Division" as an extra, 9th (sub)division of the Championship Event. Carter is not in http://www.thebluealliance.com/events or http://www.usfirst.org/roboticsprograms/frc/blog-New-Subdivision-Names

report.label: bug
report.description: It's still in the search indexes. Best fix is to update the database schema to have event key in the SearchEvent table be a foreign key and have deletes cascade so we don't have to worry about this problem. The simpler fix is to lazily delete search index for nonexstent events (so, delete when event is null and don't render). This is preferable to deleting indexes when the Events table is updated, because the delete is done via a SQL where clause, which we can't use to also delete the index (different tables).

report.summary: Team historical event data does not always display
report.label: bug
report.description: When I try to view a teams historical events and their records I only see 2015 events: (Note that the year at the top is 2013, not 2015) It happens for any team. Here are the simple steps to get into this state: 1: Start the TBA app 2: Pull up the menu and select Teams 3: Select any team (I chose Team 1) 4: After the Info tab loads, select the Events tab. Their 2015 events display 5: Select the first 2015 event and let it load. 6: Press back to get to the Events tab. 7: From the year list at the top select any year (I chose 2013) The 2015 event data still displays. No matter what year I pick now (2014, 2011, etc) the events listed will only be for 2015. I reproduced this on my Galaxy S3 and my Galaxy Tab Pro 12.2 using the TBA 2.1.4.

report.label: bug
report.description: When a summary notification exceeds 7 entries, it shows @17041057 for the rest. I verified that the app is passing the right data to NotificationCompatBuilder, and indeed a web search shows that it's an Android 5.1 bug. The bug does not appear to be in NotificationCompatJellybean so I think the choices are Live with it and hope Google fixes it. Rather than adding 8+ items to a summary notification on Android 5.1, add 6 items plus a "more..." line. That seems reasonable, although not a big deal.

report.summary: GameDay causes skipped frames on branch appv3-datafeed
report.label: bug
report.description: GameDay is very laggy and drops frames. Also, for example if you switch between GameDay and Events back and forth a bunch of times, then swiping through tabs in Events will start lagging and dropping frames too. Killing the app and restarting it fixes the issue.

report.summary: TeamAtEvent Summary Binder Shows No Data Too Soon
report.label: bug
report.description: When the data is initially loaded for the first time (nothing in db), the no data view is bound immediately, instead of after keeping the spinner visible until the network request gets fixed

report.label: bug
report.description: Shows spinner forever. Need to investigate. Prerequisite to #437

report.label: bug
report.description: Current solution (just a view) doesn't play nice with FAB. We should update to a Snackbar, which should be able to handle all that. We should also abstract out the info message stuff from ViewEventActivity so that we can also show Admin Messages (see the-blue-alliance/the-blue-alliance#1303) without the warning decorations.

report.summary: Fix Wording in myTBA Skip Confirmation
report.label: bug
report.description:
Running the current code in master, 4a3eac2: Once it fetches the initial data and the user continues past the startup screen, it opens a modal dialog: Are you sure you don't want to enable myTBA?
You can always enable it later in Settings.
CANCEL YES Wait, what? Does CANCEL mean "No, I don't want to enable myTBA", or "I'm not sure I don't want to enable myTBA", or "Don't do anything"? What does YES mean? Suggestion: Do you want to enable myTBA?
You can always enable it later in Settings.
NOW MAYBE LATER https://twitter.com/howardtayler/status/544526400674205698

report.summary: Bug: lists scroll to top when resuming activity
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: open an event scroll to "Rankings" tab scroll to bottom of list click on last team once the activity loads, click "Back" (not up, that triggers a different issue) observe how after a second, the list jumps back to the top This actually applies to all tabs in the activity: if you swipe between several tabs, scroll them all down, then do the above process, they will all be scrolled to the top. There's no reason scroll position shouldn't be persisted. This appears in several places throughout the app, not only in the "Events" activity.

report.summary: Most EventTeams not being cached locally
report.label: bug
report.description: While investigating #545, I discovered that most (but not all) EventTeams aren't being cached in the database. Specifically, most of the time EventTeamsTable.getEvents(...) will return nothing due to an empty cursor, even after the cache definitely should have been populated with the appropriate things. There are some exceptions: on my device, Palmetto 2015 and 2016 are consistently cached, as are some other events (check out the database in Stetho to see exactly what's there). This doesn't really impact user experience, as the network requests will take care of populating things pretty quickly, but this should really be fixed for correctness' sake.

report.summary: Recent Notifications doesn't play nicely with live incoming notifications
report.label: bug
report.description: If you get a few notifications in the background and then open Recent Notifications, everything works as expected. However, if you're in the activity and a new notification comes in, you're left with a disappointing and useless "summary" card for the new notification. Quitting and restarting the activity makes everything render nicely again.

report.summary: ListViewBinder throws exception when it tries to access ListView
report.label: bug
report.description: I've only seen this behavior with the main teams list. When the lists come back into the foreground and we attempt to bind new data to them, we get a ton of these exceptions. The easy solution would just be to check if the list is null before accessing it, but the real question is why is the list null in the first place? The binder should be able to hold on to the reference to the ListView even when it goes into the background and then comes back into the foreground. 02-22 17:58:09.679 12892-12892/? report.summary: Match video page contents 'stick' sometimes when scrolling
report.label: bug
report.description: I upgraded to 3.1.0, cleared my cache and then started using the app. I eventually got to the point where the match video page looked like an MTV flashback: The steps I took to get there (twice) were the following: 1: Start the app 2: From the 2016 Events view I select the Week 0 Offseason event in Merrimakc NH 3: Slide over to the teams list and selecte Team 125 4: Slide over to their matches and selected any of the video play options. (For the screenshots I selected Qual 3) 5: The match info displays at the top and the available videos appear below just fine eventually. 6: I start to scroll the display up to see all the video choices available. That is when a copy of the original the contents appear to "stick" in the background while contents scroll up: A little further gets me to: If I keep scrolling I get to the screenshot at the top. This reproduced 2 out of 3 times I tried it on my Samsung G6. 2 observations that may be relevant: 1: The video thumbnails took a while to load a couple times I was trying (and once when trying to reproduce). 2: One of the reproduced times my phone switched from Wi-Fi to 4G (stupid hospital Wi-Fi!). I noticed this because that time I did not get video thumbnails like the other times.

report.label: bug
report.description: For 2016 Sacramento stats, the Android app says High Score Quals: 162 in Q22 (correct), Playoffs: 172 in QF1-1 (no, that score was surpassed by 205 in SF1-1 and 192 in F1). The Insights web page is correct. Other stats differ between the Insights web page and the app's Event Stats, esp. Playoffs stats such as Average High Goals: 6 in the app, 4.91 on the web site Average Win Margin: 101 in the app, 56.69 on the web site Average Foul Score: 0 in the app, 3.59 on the web site Low Bar # Damaged / # Opportunities: 2 / 2 in the app, 30 / 32 on the web site

I think the desired behavior should be to maintain the current year when switching modes if possible, or else default to the current year.

report.summary: Fix Current Week Display on Gaps
report.label: bug
report.description: When there are no events "this week" it should display the next week in advance, instead of the previous one.

report.label: bug
report.description: At Chezy Champs 2016 today, match scores finally started flowing through to TBA at 19:45 PT, after the event ended for the day. Then match score Firebase Cloud Messages (FCMs) started arriving every few seconds. I watched them arrive on a Nexus 7 Marshmallow tablet and a Nexus 5X Nougat phone. When I pulled down an FCM's notification view and let the view stay open, when following FCMs arrived, one or both devices played notification tones, Marshmallow accumulated additional lines in the app's notification view, but Nougat did not. When I swiped away the notification view on Nougat, those additional match-score notification lines never did appear although they are present in the app's Recent Notifications list, and the next incoming FCM would appear as a new notification view. Apparently, additional info arriving while the app's pull-down notification view is open doesn't successfully add to that view.

report.summary: There's a solid screen in the Back stack
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Upgrade from the current release to today's beta release (4.0.0, 2/20/17 11:44, commit 16424d8). Open the app and proceed to download the data updates. Tap to finish that. IIRC it now shows "2017 Events". Tap the Back button. Result: There are no navigational controls here besides the 3 system buttons at the bottom, not even a left side Nav Drawer. (The first time, I dived into a preseason event and myTBA between steps 3 and 4. I did the shorter sequence above on another Android.) This is a very minor problem. Tapping the Back button again exits the app. But the Back stack has occasionally done some weird things for a while.

report.summary: "No Connection Error" appears someties on v4.0 upgrade
report.label: bug
report.description: Doesn't seem to happen all the time. It's because we sometimes haven't loaded the APIv3 token yet, so we're getting 400s back. We should make that logic a little more resilient to this kind of thing
